intro: Chaerophyllum villarsii var. cicutariiforme, commonly known as the slender chaerophyllum, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodland areas. Due to its delicate appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species in some regions.
